details.publicNotes: Large Shufflers appear much like small ones but take on the form of larger legs, either a swarm of smaller legs or two to six massive trunks that have no connection, and aren't always the same, make up their body.

description.value:
Trigger A creature grabs or restrains the Shuffler.

Effect The shuffler ceases being @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed} and teleports to a point within 15 feet, often as a new set of legs.

By marching towards a creature it doesn't have to actually approach but does have to be within 20 feet, the Shuffler menaces with the sound of a thousand approaching feet. Make an @Check[intimidation|against:will] check against the Will DC of the enemy.

Critical Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2}.

Success The creature becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

The shuffler may Stride and Stomp any creature it passes through. It may pass through enemy squares while doing this without difficulty, though provokes reactions normally. They automatically hit anyone taking a reaction against the creature, avoiding its need to roll to attack. It cannot attack the same enemy twice.
The Shuffler vanishes and appears anywhere in Stride range as if it took a single step, possibly in different directions, and ended up where it wanted.

The Shuffler attacks a creature it has already Struck since the start of its turn. If it hits, the Shuffler Trips it without the attack trait (thus taking and causing no multiple attack penalty for the trip).

Until the start of the Shuffler's next turn, any audible effect (and spells with a verbal component) used within 30 feet of the shuffler must succeed on a @Check[flat|dc:6] or fail due to the noise it generates with its discordant feet.
